p: Weil disease is the icteric form of the infection and occurs in 5â€“10 % of patients. It too has a biphasic illness with an earlier phase that is marked by jaundice. High fever and renal manifestations with acute tubular necrosis develop in the second phase and often lead to renal failure. There is a high mortality. Hemorrhagic complications are frequent and follow immune complex deposition leading to capillary injury. Serological tests and cultures help in diagnosis. Doxycycline is usually used for treatment [ 22, 23].
